evals.prompt: I need to add real-time notifications to our Next.js app. Users should get notified when someone comments on their post, likes their content, or follows them.
evals.expected_output: A thorough exploration of the notification problem space covering multiple paradigms (polling, SSE, WebSockets, push notifications, third-party services), with a tradeoff analysis and recommendation based on evidence.

evals.prompt: We need to implement a plugin system for our CLI tool so third-party developers can extend it with custom commands. The tool is written in TypeScript.
evals.expected_output: An exploration of plugin architecture paradigms (dynamic imports, subprocess-based, hook systems, middleware chains, etc.) with analysis of discoverability, security, and developer experience tradeoffs.

evals.prompt: Add a search bar to the dashboard that filters the table of results.
evals.expected_output: Despite seeming simple, the skill should surface hidden complexity (client vs server filtering, fuzzy vs exact matching, debouncing, URL state sync, accessibility) and explore paradigms before recommending an approach.
